section.text: *NOTE: This section was created by emergency legislation that will expire on January 30, 2023.*
section.heading: Definitions.

para.text: For the purposes of this subchapter, the term:
"Condition" means a rating of good, fair, poor, or very poor that assesses the working or operational effectiveness of a building system.
"DCPS" means District of Columbia Public Schools.
"DGS" means the Department of General Services.
"Editable data table" means a Microsoft Excel workbook or similar software format that allows a reader to edit and sort dataset contents.
"Facilities condition assessment" means a review of each school building as required by the Master Facilities Plan annual supplement pursuant to § 38-2803(b)(2A).
"HEPA" means a high efficiency particulate air filter, as defined by the U.S. Department of Energy.
"HVAC" means a heating, ventilation, and air conditioning system.

"Interior door" means a door inside a school building that opens to a classroom, hallway, administrative office, or other room wherein school students or staff work, learn, or congregate. The term excludes doors to restrooms.
"School" means a school operated by DCPS.

section.codify:annotation: For temporary (90 days) creation of § 38-953.01, see § 101 of Back-to-School Safely Emergency Act of 2022 (D.C. Act 24-598, Nov. 1, 2022, 0 DCR 0).
For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 101 of Back-to-School Safely Emergency Act of 2022 (D.C. Act 24-598, Nov. 1, 2022, 0 DCR 0).
